name: FLYING THE BEECH 1900C! Pacific Coastal Victoria to Vancouver
description:
Pacific Coastal Airlines, or Pasco, is a Canadian regional airline that flies within British Columbia, and also operates flights for WestJet Link in Alberta. They’re primarily based out of the south terminal at Vancouver International Airport, and have a fleet of Saab 340s and Beechcraft 1900s. 

Today, I'm flying on one of their Beechcraft 1900Cs from Victoria to Vancouver. See what I thought of the Pasco experience in this trip report!

Big thank you to the person who made this flight possible, you know who you are, and I really appreciate the support :)

Thanks as well to Brandon for his hospitality during my stay in Victoria, go check him out: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWq8ksng53Nzi0iMA4_rE_w

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Pacific Coastal Airlines (PCO/8P)
Aircraft: Beechcraft 1900C (B190)
Flight Number: 8P1524
Seat: 1A
Livery: New (2015)
Engines: 2x Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-67D 
Registration: C-FPCX
Route: Victoria (YYJ) - Vancouver (YVR)
Callsign: PASCO 1524
Runway used: 27 (YYJ) - 08R (YVR)
Date filmed: November 2019
